text: The presidency of the Council of the European Union is responsible for the work of the Council of the European Union, which is the co-legislator of the EU legislature along with the European Parliament. The role is given to member states of the EU every six months. The presidency is not an individual, but a role that is held by a national government. The presidency is currently, held by Poland, since January 2025. ==References== Category:European Union
title: Presidency of the Council of the European Union
